title: Oscar Winner Diane Keaton Dies at 79
snippets: She was best known for roles in films including in The Father of the Bride, The Godfather and Annie Hall.
Keaton was best known for her roles in Annie Hall, Reds and The Godfather films.
Diane Keaton's first big break was in the 1970s in "The Godfather" series. She also won an Oscar in 1978 for "Annie Hall."
Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning actress known for her performances in "Annie Hall" and "The Godfather," has died at the age of 79.

The legendary actor best known for her many collaborations with Woody Allen, as well as films including Reds, The First Wives Club and Book Club, has died Diane Keaton: a life in pictures Peter Bradshaw on Diane Keaton Keaton interviewed in 2023 and 2014 Diane Keaton, one of the best-loved film star
Oscar-winning actor Diane Keaton, known for iconic roles in Annie Hall, The Godfather and Father of the Bride, has died at 79, confirmed by a family member.
Diane Keaton, who rose to fame in "The Godfather" trilogy and "Annie Hall," died on October 11. She was 79.
People Magazine reported Saturday that she died in California with loved ones, citing a family spokesperson.

LOS ANGELES (AP) — Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning star of ‘Annie Hall,’ ‘The Godfather’ films and ‘Father of the Bride,’ whose quirky, vibrant manner and depth made her one of the most singular actors of a generation, has died. She was 79. People Magazine reported Saturday that she died in Californ

summary: Diane Keaton, the Oscar-winning actress renowned for her roles in "Annie Hall" and "The Godfather," has died at the age of 79 in California. Her career, spanning over five decades, made her a beloved figure in Hollywood. The news was confirmed by People magazine.

Former US President Joe Biden has started radiation therapy to treat an aggressive form of prostate cancer that has spread to his bones.

title: Trump Ensures Military Pay Amid US Government Shutdown Standoff
snippets: Many government institutions are affected by a shutdown of the US government. DW explains the mechanisms and consequences of the latest budget gridlock in Washington.
The Trump administration and Republicans have sought to blame Democrats for the government shutdown, and any negative fallout from it.
Republicans were under pressure to issue pay cheques to US forces as congressional stand-off drags on

President claims he found a way to pay troops and directed Pentagon chief to release funds on 15 October Donald Trump claimed on Saturday that he had found a way to pay US military troops despite the ongoing federal government shutdown, saying he had instructed his defence secretary, Pete Hegseth ,
Trump Says US Troops Will Be Paid on Oct. 15 Despite Shutdown Bloomberg.com
Trump said Saturday the White House has “identified the funds” to ensure troops receive their paychecks on Oct. 15.
titles: What happens during a US government shutdown?
Trump says 'a lot' of federal workers are being laid off during government shutdown
Trump says military will be paid during US government shutdown
Trump says military members will be paid despite government shutdown
Trump Says US Troops Will Be Paid on Oct. 15 Despite Shutdown - Bloomberg.com
Military Will Receive Paychecks Despite Shutdown, Trump Says
summary: The US government shutdown has impacted many federal institutions, leading to a budget deadlock in Washington. Amidst this, President Trump and Republicans have blamed Democrats for the shutdown and its negative effects. Despite the standoff, Trump announced that he had found a way to ensure US military personnel would be paid, instructing Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to release funds for troop paychecks on October 15. This move came as Republicans faced pressure to maintain pay for US forces during the shutdown.

title: Trump Administration Finds Funds to Pay Troops Amid Shutdown
snippets: President Trump's announcement comes days before active duty members would have missed their first full paycheck as the shutdown of the federal government continues.
President Donald Trump on Saturday said his administration has "identified funds" to pay troops next week despite the federal government shutdown.
A spokesperson for the White House Office of Management and Budget said Pentagon research and development funds would be used to pay the salaries.
titles: Trump directs Pentagon to use 'available funds' to pay military during shutdown
Trump says administration has 'identified funds' to pay troops during shutdown
Pentagon to use R&D money to pay troops during government shutdown
summary: President Donald Trump announced that his administration has found funds to ensure troops will be paid next week amid the ongoing federal government shutdown. The White House Office of Management and Budget specified that Pentagon research and development funds will be utilized for the troops' salaries, preventing active duty members from missing their first full paycheck due to the shutdown.

title: Scheifele Leads Jets to First Season Win with 3-2 Victory Over Kings
snippets: Mark Scheifele proved once again how leaders make the difference in close games.
Mark Scheifele scored his second goal of the game midway through the third period to give the Winnipeg Jets a hard-fought 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Kings on Saturday afternoon.
Scheifele scores twice, Jets defeat Kings for 1st win NHL.com
titles: Scheifele showing leadership for Jets
Scheifele scores twice as Jets beat Kings
Scheifele scores twice, Jets defeat Kings for 1st win - NHL.com
Mark Scheifele scores tying, winning goals as Jets top Kings
summary: Mark Scheifele scored twice, including the winning goal in the third period, leading the Winnipeg Jets to a 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Kings. This win marks the Jets' first of the season.

title: No. 7 Indiana Ends Losing Streak, Beats No. 3 Oregon 30-20
snippets: Indiana remained undefeated with a 30-20 win over No. 3 Oregon. The win snapped a record streak of losses to AP top-five opponents.
Curt Cignetti showed up to Eugene with his Hoosiers prepared and handed Dan Lanning just his third ever loss in Autzen Stadium in No. 7 Indiana's stunning upset of No. 4 Oregon.
Fernando Mendoza threw for 215 yards and a key fourth-quarter touchdown and No. 7 Indiana remained undefeated with a 30-20 victory over No. 3 Oregon on Saturday.
titles: Indiana topples No. 3 Oregon to stay unbeaten
No. 7 Indiana topples No. 3 Oregon 30-20 in tight battle
Indiana beats Oregon in battle of unbeaten teams
summary: No. 7 Indiana achieved an undefeated status by defeating No. 3 Oregon 30-20, breaking a streak of losses to AP top-five teams. This significant win was led by Coach Curt Cignetti and quarterback Fernando Mendoza, who threw for 215 yards and a crucial touchdown. The victory marked a rare loss for Oregon's Dan Lanning at Autzen Stadium.

title: 18 Presumed Dead After Explosion at Tennessee Munitions Factory
snippets: Operations go from rescue to recovery as no survivors expected to be found, officials say.
The Humphreys County sheriff confirmed fatalities but gave no tolls, suggesting those missing might already be dead.

Initial toll after explosions at plant near McEwen on Friday was believed to be 19 people but later revised to 18. There were no survivors in the blast that obliterated part of an explosives factory in rural Tennessee , authorities said on Saturday. The families of 18 people had been waiting anxious
titles: No survivors found after Tennessee explosives plant blast
'No survivors' found after Tennessee plant blast
No survivors in Tennessee explosives factory blast, officials say
summary: Following an explosion at Accurate Energetic Systems, a munitions factory in Tennessee, 18 individuals initially reported missing are now presumed dead, according to officials. The operation has shifted from rescue to recovery, with no survivors expected. The factory, located near McEwen, specializes in explosives for various industries. The incident occurred on Friday, with officials confirming the transition to recovery efforts on Saturday.

title: Hull KR Wins First Super League Title, Ends Wigan's Streak at Old Trafford
snippets: Watch highlights as Hull KR beat Wigan Warriors to win the Super League Grand Final for the first time and complete a historic treble.

Hull KR 24-6 Wigan Wigan denied third successive title As Joe Burgess raced away in the final moments to put the seal on an unprecedented season in Hull KR’s 143-year history, it was difficult to know where to look first as decadesof frustration poured out all around Old Trafford. The Robins began t
Highlights of the Super League Grand Final between Hull KR and Wigan Warriors.
titles: Hull KR beat Wigan to win first Super League title

History-makers! Hull KR claim stunning Super League Grand Final win over Wigan
summary: Hull KR won their first Super League title, defeating Wigan Warriors 24-6 at Old Trafford, preventing Wigan from securing a third consecutive title. This victory marks Hull KR's completion of a historic treble, their first major trophy win in 40 years. A bus parade in Hull is planned to celebrate the team's achievement.

title: Canadian Activists Detained by Israel on Gaza Aid Mission Released
snippets: Indigenous rights activist Mskwaasin Agnew is expected to land in Toronto today after being detained by Israeli forces while aboard a flotilla attempting to deliver aid to Gaza.

The first of six Canadian activists aboard a flotilla that was detained by Israeli forces while attempting to bring humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip has returned home. Indigenous rights activist Mskwaasin Agnew landed at Toronto’s Pearson International Airport on Saturday afternoon, greeted by a g
titles: Indigenous activist who was on Gaza-bound flotilla is returning to Canada
Activists from Gaza-bound flotilla expected to return to Canada this weekend
summary: Indigenous rights activist Mskwaasin Agnew and Montreal epidemiologist Nimâ Machouf, both Canadians, were detained by Israeli forces while on a flotilla delivering aid to Gaza. Agnew is expected in Toronto today, while Machouf is set to arrive in Montreal on Sunday, according to her husband. Both were part of a mission to bring humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip.

title: North Korea Displays New Missile at Party's 80th Anniversary Parade
snippets: North Korea showcased its newest intercontinental ballistic missile, the Hwasong-20, during a military parade.
Kim Jong Un's leadership delivered a speech as his military showed off a new intercontinental ballistic missile in a massive parade. Kim also held talks with Russia's Dmitry Medvedev.
The parade, held in North Korea’s capital to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the ruling Workers’ Party, ​gave its leader a chance to show off his growing power.
titles: North Korea shows off new intercontinental ballistic missile
North Korea displays long-range missile at parade
North Korea Flaunts New Missiles ​in Parade With Chinese and Russian Officials
summary: On the 80th anniversary of North Korea's ruling Workers' Party, a parade in the capital showcased the new Hwasong-20 intercontinental ballistic missile. Leader Kim Jong Un delivered a speech during the event, which also featured discussions with Russia's Dmitry Medvedev, highlighting North Korea's military capabilities and diplomatic connections.

title: 53 Killed in Darfur Shelter Attack Amid Sudan Conflict
snippets: At least 53 people, including women and children, were killed in a shelling and drone attack by Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) on a shelter for displaced families.

CAIRO (AP) — A shelling and drone attack by the Sudanese paramilitary forces hit a shelter in a besieged city in the Darfur region, killing at least 53 people, a doctors’ group said Saturday. The onslaught was the latest in Sudan’s more than two-year war. The Sudan Doctors’ Network, a group of medic
titles: Sudanese paramilitary attack kills at least 53 people in Darfur, an aid group says
A Sudanese paramilitary attack kills at least 53 people in Darfur, an aid group says
summary: At least 53 individuals, including women and children, were killed in Darfur, Sudan, following a shelling and drone attack by the Rapid Support Forces on a shelter for displaced families. This incident, reported by the Sudan Doctors’ Network, marks a recent escalation in Sudan's ongoing conflict.

title: Manning Leads Texas to 23-6 Win Over Oklahoma in Red River Rivalry
snippets: Arch Manning was 21-of-27 passing for 166 yards and Texas got a much-needed 23-6 win over sixth-ranked Oklahoma.

Ryan Niblett returned a punt 75 yards for a decisive touchdown in the fourth quarter and Texas got a much-needed 23-6 win over sixth-ranked Oklahoma in their annual Red River Rivalry game on Saturday.
titles: Manning powers Texas to upset win over No. 6 OU
Arch Manning, Texas get timely win over No. 6 Oklahoma in Red River Rivalry
summary: Arch Manning completed 21 of 27 passes for 166 yards, leading Texas to a 23-6 victory over sixth-ranked Oklahoma in the Red River Rivalry. Ryan Niblett's 75-yard punt return for a touchdown in the fourth quarter was pivotal in securing the win for Texas.

Sportsnet's Blake Murphy discussed the Mariners' victory and the strategic choices facing the Blue Jays with Ken Reid and Evanka Osmak.

summary: Penn State quarterback Drew Allar, seen as a potential first-round pick for the 2026 NFL draft, sustained a season-ending injury in the fourth quarter against Northwestern, concluding his college career due to his senior status and lack of eligibility for future seasons.

title: Apple Discontinues Clips Video Editing App
snippets: Apple’s Clips video editing app is no more. It debuted in 2017 as a way to stitch together videos with music, text, and filters with a clear focus on sharing to social media. Over the years Apple added AR features and more advanced video editing tools. But recently updates had slowed to a trickle. A
Apple appears to be winding down support of Clips, with the company removing Clips from the App Store and saying it will no longer be making any updates.
titles: Apple ends support for Clips video-editing app
Apple says goodbye to the Clips app
summary: Apple has discontinued its Clips video editing app, which launched in 2017 to allow users to create videos with music, text, and filters for social media. Despite adding AR features and advanced editing tools over time, updates had recently diminished. The company has removed Clips from the App Store and confirmed it will not provide further updates.

title: Central Bankers in Washington Fear Market Crash Amid Trade, Debt Concerns
snippets: Stock Bubble Dread Grips Central Bankers in Washington Bloomberg.com
Central bankers, already uneasy about trade tensions and swelling public debt, will collectively confront a new worry in the coming week: the danger of a market crash.
titles: Stock Bubble Dread Grips Central Bankers in Washington - Bloomberg.com

summary: Central bankers in Washington are increasingly concerned about the potential for a market crash, adding to existing worries about trade tensions and rising public debt. This collective apprehension will be a key focus in their upcoming meetings.

summary: As the corporate earnings season begins, traders, buoyed by a record surge in US stocks, have high expectations for company performances. They are particularly focused on the impacts of tariffs and artificial intelligence (AI) spending, showing limited tolerance for companies that fail to meet these elevated expectations.

title: US Corporate Bonds Hit Decades-High Valuation Amid Rally Potential
snippets: Corporate Debt Is Benefiting as US Looks More Like an Emerging Market: Credit Weekly Bloomberg.com

US corporate bonds are trading at their highest valuations in decades, but to some investors and strategists, it’s partly an illusion fueled by government dysfunction, and company debt has room to rally more.

summary: US corporate bonds are at their highest valuations in decades, with some attributing this partly to government dysfunction. Despite these high valuations, investors and strategists believe there's potential for further rallies in company debt.

title: NC State Engineers Develop Shape-Shifting Polymer and Sunlike LED Technology
snippets: A team of engineers at North Carolina State University has designed a polymer “Chinese lantern” that can rapidly snap into multiple stable 3D shapes—including a lantern, a spinning top, and more—by compression or twisting. By adding a magnetic layer, they achieved remote control of the shape-shiftin

Scientists have developed an ultra-thin, paper-like LED that emits a warm, sunlike glow, promising to revolutionize how we light up our homes, devices, and workplaces. By engineering a balance of red, yellow-green, and blue quantum dots, the researchers achieved light quality remarkably close to nat
titles: Scientists create a magnetic lantern that moves like it’s alive
Scientists create a paper-thin light that glows like the sun
summary: Engineers at North Carolina State University have developed a polymer "Chinese lantern" capable of transforming into various stable 3D shapes, such as a lantern and spinning top, through compression or twisting. Adding a magnetic layer allows for remote shape control. Additionally, scientists have created an ultra-thin, paper-like LED that emits a sunlike glow by balancing red, yellow-green, and blue quantum dots, potentially revolutionizing home, device, and workplace lighting with its natural light quality.
